sentences.sContent: At the dinner table, my father would go on and on, showing off, aggrandizing himself.
sentences.sCn: 吃饭时我父亲总是不停地夸耀和吹嘘自己。

trans.tranCn: 增大， 扩张； 吹捧
trans.tranOther: To aggrandize someone means to make them seem richer, more powerful, and more important than they really are. To aggrandize a building means to make it more impressive.
